intro: Seseli leucospermum, commonly known as white-flowered seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare or endangered species in many areas.
